result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) .238 [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) .238 [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jonathan S. Harnden was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
03:22 pm - Defendant Jonathan S. Harnden in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Jonathan S. Harnden in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf233, 14cf238, 15cf26 and 14cm152 (RH).  In 15cf26 - Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State movest to dismiss 14cf238 and Counts 2-4 in case 14cf233 as well as any citations tracking with criminal cases, if any - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to 15cf26 and Count 1 in 14cf233.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Hogan/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence - Concurrent
WHS/POP 3 yrs
Fine $600 plus costs - OWI
Court Costs in 15cf26
DL revocation 2 yrs
IID 12 months
Jail 8 months - W/Huber for all purposes - Jail credit 1 day
Alcohol Assessment/Driver Safety Plan
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Jail credit of 26 days in case 15cf26
Appeal rights, NADVI given
In 14cm152 - After release from jail - to be paid off as a condition of probation
from Koinonia
Included on bond set in 14cf238
Includes 14cf233.  No intoxicants, no taverns. Strictly comply with Aftercare Program, Forward written copy of Aftercare plan to the Court ten days from release.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Pre-trial conference on February 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jonathan S. Harnden in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:37
Calling 14cf233 and 14cf238 for arraignment and 14cm152 for fine review
In receipt of information in 14cf233 only 14cf233 information now filed with Court- 14cf238 will be filed and will mirror the complaint  - Hogan willing to proceed and waive readings- not guilty plea - defendant is koinonia - may file motion to modify bond when treatment is complete - 
in regards to 14cm152 - defendant still owes $263.50 - Court statement - will track along but wants paid by dispo of other 2 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
State's Exh. 1 (Police Report) and State's Exh. 2 (Harnden driving record)
May be released for purposes of inpatient treatment only - when not in treatment, must be in custody unless bond posted.

11:33 a.m. Defendant Jonathan S. Harnden in court, in custody, with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CF238. 

14CF233 - State's Exh. 1 (Police Report) marked, offered. State calls Officer Tate, Minocqua P.D., sworn, direct. Hogan objects to receipt of State's Exh. 1. Court will allow exhibit testimony at this time. Hogan statement--continues objection to receipt of State's Exh. 1. Court statement--finds foundation laid by Officer Tate is sufficient to admit hearsay. Court receives State's Exh. 1. Witness identifies defendant. State's Exh. 2 (Harnden driving record) marked, offered, received. Cross by Hogan. Court statement--finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  
14CF238 - State calls Officer Tate. Court reminds officer he is still under oath. Direct by Michlig. Witness identifies defendant. Cross by Hogan. State's Exh. 1 (Bond form in 14CF233) marked, offered, received. Hogan statement. Court statement--finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. Hogan/Michlig statement to bond. State does not object to inpatient treatment facility as part of cash bail. Court statement--defendant may be released for purposes of participating in inpatient treatment. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Included on bond set in 14cf238.

01:18 pm - Reese for Bloom - Defendant Jonathan S. Harnden in court, via video, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BR II JA informs Mary Hogan will be representing and requested a preliminary hearing date.   Schiek states will send through paperwork for forfeiture of $1,000 cash bond set in case 14cf233.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 11:30 am.  Court sets $5,000 cash bond in case 14cf238 which includes 14cf233.
no intoxicants in any amount in any location, no taverns

01:32 pm - Defendant Jonathan S. Harnden in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint to be faxed to jail, Court reviews complaint with defendant, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
of Search Warrant
